常見問題：

AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。

AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。

今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。

簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥）

‘Gattuso has the right personality’

Former Milan midfielder Massimo Ambrosini believes the club made “a brave choice” in appointing Gennaro Gattuso - “sometimes chemistry can overcome experience”.

Vincenzo Montella was sacked by the Rossoneri earlier today, with the Primavera Coach stepping up to replace him, despite patchy spells with FC Sion, Palermo, OFI Crete and Pisa.

“The club has made a brave choice in choosing Rino,” Gattuso’s former teammate Ambrosini told Sky.

“In some cases charisma and personality can have a lot of influence, and in this case his personality can help a lot.

“He doesn’t have tremendous experience on the bench, he’ll have to immerse himself in it immediately, but sometimes the chemistry that can be created in a dressing room can overcome experience.”

Gattuso: ‘Bonucci is my captain’

Gennaro Gattuso confirms “the Milan captain is Leonardo Bonucci and will remain Bonucci”, and sees some of himself in Franck Kessié.

Bonucci joined the Rossoneri from Juventus this summer, and immediately replaced Riccardo Montolivo as captain.

With some poor performances from the centre-back so far, some have suggested the armband should be taken away but the new Coach has no intention of making such a change.

“The captain is Bonucci and will remain Bonucci,” Gattuso said in his presentation Press conference today.

“I spoke with a delegation from the team yesterday and I saw lads with great desire to work and make themselves available.

“I asked them for a great sense of togetherness and discipline, and they gave me their full availability.

“I would always have walked over hot coals for my teammates and that’s what I want to see from them. The players have to help each other.”

Gattuso was then asked which players he’s most curious about working with.

“Suso. They say he can only play in one role [on the wing], I want to see if that’s true. I also want to see why Kessié isn’t creating space like last year.

“Is he like me? He’s a lot stronger and more explosive than I was, and he also scores more goals than me.

“He’s the player who most resembles me right now, but I think at this point in time we need a lot of players with the right mentality.

“As for André Silva, he’s a player with huge quality. He’s one who there’s a market for even if he’s not doing well.

“He has to get in condition to play with the team, sometimes he does good things but he does them alone and not with his teammates.

“Patrick Cutrone? I very much looking at how players train, and Patrick has started on par with the other strikers.

“He’s one who never gives up and has great passion, and we need more people with that mentality.”

Gattuso has arguably the easiest start he could hope for, as the Diavolo face bottom club Benevento at the weekend, with the Stregoni having lost every match so far.

“There are no easy games in Serie A. We’ll have to be ready and prepare for games in the best way.”

The former midfielder finished his conference by discussing what he wants to see from his side from now until the end of the season.

“We’re though in the Europa League and we still have to play in the Coppa Italia. This shirt has a weight to it, and we must never forget that.

“I want them to see that there’s a huge difference between winning and losing: when you lose you have to be burning up inside, at Milanello it’s like a funeral.

“There are 72 points left to be won, and I can’t just be seen as a caretaker. I know not everyone likes me, but I know what I can give my teams.

“I’m someone who feels matches. When I go to the pitch now I feel the same tingling as I did when I was a player.

“Some players will be crucial here, but they have to work.”

Gattuso: ‘Bonucci is my captain’

Gennaro Gattuso confirms “the Milan captain is Leonardo Bonucci and will remain Bonucci”, and sees some of himself in Franck Kessié.

Bonucci joined the Rossoneri from Juventus this summer, and immediately replaced Riccardo Montolivo as captain.

With some poor performances from the centre-back so far, some have suggested the armband should be taken away but the new Coach has no intention of making such a change.

“The captain is Bonucci and will remain Bonucci,” Gattuso said in his presentation Press conference today.

“I spoke with a delegation from the team yesterday and I saw lads with great desire to work and make themselves available.

“I asked them for a great sense of togetherness and discipline, and they gave me their full availability.

“I would always have walked over hot coals for my teammates and that’s what I want to see from them. The players have to help each other.”

Gattuso was then asked which players he’s most curious about working with.

“Suso. They say he can only play in one role [on the wing], I want to see if that’s true. I also want to see why Kessié isn’t creating space like last year.

“Is he like me? He’s a lot stronger and more explosive than I was, and he also scores more goals than me.

“He’s the player who most resembles me right now, but I think at this point in time we need a lot of players with the right mentality.

“As for André Silva, he’s a player with huge quality. He’s one who there’s a market for even if he’s not doing well.

“He has to get in condition to play with the team, sometimes he does good things but he does them alone and not with his teammates.

“Patrick Cutrone? I very much looking at how players train, and Patrick has started on par with the other strikers.

“He’s one who never gives up and has great passion, and we need more people with that mentality.”

Gattuso has arguably the easiest start he could hope for, as the Diavolo face bottom club Benevento at the weekend, with the Stregoni having lost every match so far.

“There are no easy games in Serie A. We’ll have to be ready and prepare for games in the best way.”

The former midfielder finished his conference by discussing what he wants to see from his side from now until the end of the season.

“We’re though in the Europa League and we still have to play in the Coppa Italia. This shirt has a weight to it, and we must never forget that.

“I want them to see that there’s a huge difference between winning and losing: when you lose you have to be burning up inside, at Milanello it’s like a funeral.

“There are 72 points left to be won, and I can’t just be seen as a caretaker. I know not everyone likes me, but I know what I can give my teams.

“I’m someone who feels matches. When I go to the pitch now I feel the same tingling as I did when I was a player.

“Some players will be crucial here, but they have to work.”

Gattuso: ‘Bonucci is my captain’

Gennaro Gattuso confirms “the Milan captain is Leonardo Bonucci and will remain Bonucci”, and sees some of himself in Franck Kessié.

Bonucci joined the Rossoneri from Juventus this summer, and immediately replaced Riccardo Montolivo as captain.

With some poor performances from the centre-back so far, some have suggested the armband should be taken away but the new Coach has no intention of making such a change.

“The captain is Bonucci and will remain Bonucci,” Gattuso said in his presentation Press conference today.

“I spoke with a delegation from the team yesterday and I saw lads with great desire to work and make themselves available.

“I asked them for a great sense of togetherness and discipline, and they gave me their full availability.

“I would always have walked over hot coals for my teammates and that’s what I want to see from them. The players have to help each other.”

Gattuso was then asked which players he’s most curious about working with.

“Suso. They say he can only play in one role [on the wing], I want to see if that’s true. I also want to see why Kessié isn’t creating space like last year.

“Is he like me? He’s a lot stronger and more explosive than I was, and he also scores more goals than me.

“He’s the player who most resembles me right now, but I think at this point in time we need a lot of players with the right mentality.

“As for André Silva, he’s a player with huge quality. He’s one who there’s a market for even if he’s not doing well.

“He has to get in condition to play with the team, sometimes he does good things but he does them alone and not with his teammates.

“Patrick Cutrone? I very much looking at how players train, and Patrick has started on par with the other strikers.

“He’s one who never gives up and has great passion, and we need more people with that mentality.”

Gattuso has arguably the easiest start he could hope for, as the Diavolo face bottom club Benevento at the weekend, with the Stregoni having lost every match so far.

“There are no easy games in Serie A. We’ll have to be ready and prepare for games in the best way.”

The former midfielder finished his conference by discussing what he wants to see from his side from now until the end of the season.

“We’re though in the Europa League and we still have to play in the Coppa Italia. This shirt has a weight to it, and we must never forget that.

“I want them to see that there’s a huge difference between winning and losing: when you lose you have to be burning up inside, at Milanello it’s like a funeral.

“There are 72 points left to be won, and I can’t just be seen as a caretaker. I know not everyone likes me, but I know what I can give my teams.

“I’m someone who feels matches. When I go to the pitch now I feel the same tingling as I did when I was a player.

“Some players will be crucial here, but they have to work.”

Gattuso: ‘Bonucci is my captain’

Gennaro Gattuso confirms “the Milan captain is Leonardo Bonucci and will remain Bonucci”, and sees some of himself in Franck Kessié.

Bonucci joined the Rossoneri from Juventus this summer, and immediately replaced Riccardo Montolivo as captain.

With some poor performances from the centre-back so far, some have suggested the armband should be taken away but the new Coach has no intention of making such a change.

“The captain is Bonucci and will remain Bonucci,” Gattuso said in his presentation Press conference today.

“I spoke with a delegation from the team yesterday and I saw lads with great desire to work and make themselves available.

“I asked them for a great sense of togetherness and discipline, and they gave me their full availability.

“I would always have walked over hot coals for my teammates and that’s what I want to see from them. The players have to help each other.”

Gattuso was then asked which players he’s most curious about working with.

“Suso. They say he can only play in one role [on the wing], I want to see if that’s true. I also want to see why Kessié isn’t creating space like last year.

“Is he like me? He’s a lot stronger and more explosive than I was, and he also scores more goals than me.

“He’s the player who most resembles me right now, but I think at this point in time we need a lot of players with the right mentality.

“As for André Silva, he’s a player with huge quality. He’s one who there’s a market for even if he’s not doing well.

“He has to get in condition to play with the team, sometimes he does good things but he does them alone and not with his teammates.

“Patrick Cutrone? I very much looking at how players train, and Patrick has started on par with the other strikers.

“He’s one who never gives up and has great passion, and we need more people with that mentality.”

Gattuso has arguably the easiest start he could hope for, as the Diavolo face bottom club Benevento at the weekend, with the Stregoni having lost every match so far.

“There are no easy games in Serie A. We’ll have to be ready and prepare for games in the best way.”

The former midfielder finished his conference by discussing what he wants to see from his side from now until the end of the season.

“We’re though in the Europa League and we still have to play in the Coppa Italia. This shirt has a weight to it, and we must never forget that.

“I want them to see that there’s a huge difference between winning and losing: when you lose you have to be burning up inside, at Milanello it’s like a funeral.

“There are 72 points left to be won, and I can’t just be seen as a caretaker. I know not everyone likes me, but I know what I can give my teams.

“I’m someone who feels matches. When I go to the pitch now I feel the same tingling as I did when I was a player.

“Some players will be crucial here, but they have to work.”

Gattuso: "I would like to thank the boys for their positive attitude and disposition. I am very pleased with the work done this week. It is not a secret that I like to see intensity and hard work. We are trying new things, but the 3-man defence remains and we will keep working on it. I feel comfortable. From day one in training, I felt good with this team. As days go by I realise how difficult it is to manage 24, 25 players. This is my biggest concern because I would like to involve everyone. For the rest, I have no worries."

"It’s going to be a battle. We must not be fooled by their current position in the league. It is true they have won 0 points but with coach De Zerbi things have changed, now they are more dangerous and have a stronger mentality. We cannot afford to make mistakes in this match."

"My way of working is totally different from Vincenzo’s (Montella). I noticed the boys were struggling a bit but it does not mean that it is all the previous coach’s fault. We have to improve many aspects of our game, be mentally stronger and increase our intensity. A more Italian AC Milan? I don't know. Those who perform better and work harder will play in my team. I don't pay attention if the player is Italian or not, I need everyone. This week, for instance, they made it difficult for me to make choices."

“I don’t like to talk only on the individuals. Lucas Biglia is a player who needs to be physically good in order to shine. He hasn't been at his top the last weeks but still showed great disposition. We had a chat and he is important for us, although he has to improve his condition. Can Kalinic play on the side like Mandzukic? Maybe, that would give us new tactical solutions but today it seems difficult for me to ask him that. The only one who I could think of at the moment is Cutrone due to his acceleration and intensity. For the moment, Kalinic will continue to play up front." 冧掂埋加撚帥

"Every coach I played with tough me a lot, even those with whom I did not win. Among them, I can name Ancelotti, Sacchi and Capello. I only hope to do well, to work hard and get positive results".

Gattuso: 'Cannot reproach Milan'

Gennaro Gattuso “cannot reproach Milan players for anything today” after a shock 2-2 draw with Benevento, earned by a goalkeeper’s goal.

Jack Bonaventura’s opener was cancelled out by George Puscas and Nikola Kalinic took advantage of poor defending to restore the advantage. Alessio Romagnoli was sent off for a very harsh second yellow card and the Rossoneri became increasingly pinned back.

However, at the 95th minute, Danilo Cataldi pumped a hopeful free kick into the box and goalkeeper Alberto Brignoli nodded in.

“The lads gave their all, we conceded a strange goal and at the moment that’s just what our luck is,” Gattuso told Mediaset Premium just days after replacing Vincenzo Montella.

“I want to thank the players for showing their desire and commitment. We lick our wounds today, will work to improve the fitness levels and mentality, but I cannot reproach my players for anything today.”

Benevento earned their first ever Serie A point after 14 consecutive defeats.

“We could’ve developed our play better, as we lost the ball too many times playing out of defence. Trying to do something new is good, but we knew that despite the defeats, Benevento have been doing much better in terms of performance lately.

“We have a long way to go and a lot to improve.”

蒙迪拿：不了，謝謝

【now.com體育】AC米蘭早前於歐霸賽事分組賽最後一輪對陣不知名球隊大敗而回，原來在委任加度素前，曾希望蒙迪拿回巢救亡，只是被這名歐霸功臣回絕。

蒙迪拿（Vincenzo Montella）於2016/17球季帶領AC米蘭童話式勇奪歐霸席位，可是翌季因為成績低迷已被炒。繼任人加度素亦將被辭退，意大利傳媒Corriere dello Sport就爆料，指米蘭找過懞帥回歸，但後者面對無情的米蘭，只簡單地回覆：「不了，謝謝。」 雖然Corriere dello Sport未有表示有關消息是從那裡得知，但現時安坐家中的蒙迪拿，最近的確曾接受他們的專訪，只是出街的內容，沒有任何一項是關於米蘭。 蒙迪拿在訪問中提及其前球會森多利亞今季的表現，指森多戰績平平的主因是換了前鋒，由梅利爾換上了杜雲沙柏達：「這個轉變不容易，梅利爾是一名領袖，可以肩負起球隊，用憤怒去踢球，而沙柏達就只是一名運球者。當你換前鋒，就整套踢法都要換。」

蒙迪拿：不了，謝謝
